description:
Improve your putting skills at home with training software supervised by professional golfers!

▼ Three Practice Modes to Improve Your Putting
1. Solidify Your Form
Practice on a flat surface, focusing on putting the ball into the cup from a distance of 0.5m to 5m.
You can solidify your form by paying attention to the angle and practicing repeatedly.
The putter face angle, ball initial speed, and other factors are measured for each stroke, which can help improve your form.

2. Develop a Sense of Distance
You will practice long-distance putts in three situations: flat, uphill, and downhill, focusing on getting the ball close to the cup.
You will get a sense of distance by hitting the ball at distances of 5m, then 7.5m, 10m, 12.5m, and 15m.
You can also select a distance that you are not good at and practice it intensively.
The longer the distance, the more important the face angle becomes.

3. Train Your Sense of Slope
On a sloping green, practice putting from a circle around the cup at distances of 0.5m to 3m, moving clockwise to experience different slopes.
The average angle of inclination to the cup can also be set to three levels.
Using the terrain guide, you will understand the differences in how the ball rolls.
By practicing repeatedly, you will develop a sense of slope.

▼Two Unique Practice Styles
In Standard style, play with the TV or Nintendo Switch™ console in front of you, making it easy to judge distance and slope as if you were standing on the green.
In Ground style, place the Nintendo Switch™ console on the floor. The ball’s position is displayed on the ground, letting you check the impact point as you putt—just like real putting.

▼Support Features
Take on fun game modes that put your daily practice to the test.
Includes Daily Missions with new challenges each day, and a One-Putt Game where you aim for the best score in a single stroke.
Your practice results are automatically saved and can be reviewed anytime.
Left-handed play supported.
